SEARCH
Package org.jfree.data

Class DataUtilitiesTest

java.lang.Object
org.jfree.data.DataUtilitiesTest
class DataUtilitiesTest extends Object
This set of test cases exercises the several methods in the DataUtilities class in JFreeChart.

    void
    calculateColumnTotalReturnsZeroWithInvalidInput()
    It is only possible for the method to return zero if all of the numbers in the Values2D object are NULL, as a column of values whose number values are all zero is not an invalid test case, though that is the other instance in which the value returned is zero.

  • Constructor Details

    • DataUtilitiesTest

  • Method Details

    • setup

      @BeforeAll public static void setup() throws IOException, FileNotFoundException
      Setup the objects needed for the test cases to run. CSV expects data to look like the following: 
       Row/Column     One         Two     Three
          1     42000   5850    3
          2     38500   4000    2
          3   49500     3060    3
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown if there is an issue reading the category dataset from the CSV.
      FileNotFoundException - Thrown if the file behind the category dataset is not found.

    • calculateColumnTotalReturnsZeroWithInvalidInput

      @Disabled @Test public void calculateColumnTotalReturnsZeroWithInvalidInput()
      It is only possible for the method to return zero if all of the numbers in the Values2D object are NULL, as a column of values whose number values are all zero is not an invalid test case, though that is the other instance in which the value returned is zero.

    • illegalArgumentExceptionThrown

      @ParameterizedTest @ValueSource(strings={"Row","Column"}) public void illegalArgumentExceptionThrown(String dimension) throws NoSuchMethodException, SecurityException
      The only reasonable way to produce a NULL value in the dataset is to clear the table; a NULL value in a CSV file cannot be read by JFreeChart. TODO: learn how to generate invalid Values2D data objects.
      Throws:
      SecurityException - If the JVM security policy prevents reflection.
      NoSuchMethodException - If there method requested is not defined in the class.

    • correctColumnSums

      @ParameterizedTest @ArgumentsSource(org.jfree.data.CorrectColumnSumsArguments.class) public void correctColumnSums(double expected, int column)
      The method should be able to calculate the correct sum for each column. Given that the test input file has different sums for each column, any incorrect result means that the method is either calculating the correct sum of the incorrect column, or it is not calculating the correct sum for the correct column. Either possibility is a defect.ï»¿ FIXME: there are thirteen columns in the CSV HousePrices.csv; why is this occurring?

         at java.base/java.util.Objects.checkIndex(Objects.java:385)
         at java.base/java.util.ArrayList.get(ArrayList.java:427)

         at org.jfree.data.DataUtilities.calculateColumnTotal(DataUtilities.java:69)
      Parameters:
      expected - The test oracle
      column - The column for which the oracle value applies.

    • correctRowCount

      @Test public void correctRowCount()
      The reported count of rows should be equal to the actual row count in the test data.

    • correctColumnCount

      @Test public void correctColumnCount()
      The reported count of columns should be equal to the actual column count in the test data.

    • calculateRowTotalReturnsZeroWithInvalidInput

      @Disabled @Test public void calculateRowTotalReturnsZeroWithInvalidInput()
      It is only possible for the method to return zero if all of the numbers in the Values2D object are NULL, as a column of values whose number values are all zero is not an invalid test case, though that is the other instance in which the value returned is zero.     • keyedValuesReturned

      @Test public void keyedValuesReturned()
      Make the assertion operate on the interface, not a given implementation; therefore, the first interface of the implementing class is asserted to be of the interface of interest (KeyedValues).

    • keyedValuesContainsCorrectCumulativePercentages

      @Disabled @Test public void keyedValuesContainsCorrectCumulativePercentages()
      Test the DataUtilities.getCumulativePercentages(KeyedValues) method with the data from the method's example. FIXME: this test does not work because the return value from the underlying method is broken, however, the implementation is outside the class under test and so will not be corrected to make this test pass.
